Overview.Summary: The 2019 Latvian presidential election took place on May 29 (1,4,6). Egils Levits became the new president (2) after being endorsed by the center-right government coalition (8). Levits had also been a contender in the previous presidential election in 2015 (10). The election was concurrent with legislative elections in Indonesia, which took place on April 17 (3). Early voting for the European Parliament elections also began in Latvia on May 25 (5). The three candidates for Latvian president chose their favorite songs for Latvian Radio 2 (8) and prominent MEPs from Latvia reflected on the outcome of the European Parliament elections on May 27 (9).

Timeline.Text: Latvia's incumbent president announces he will not seek re-election for the 2019 Latvian presidential election.
Latvia's center-right government coalition agrees on May 29 as the date for the 2019 Latvian presidential election.
The Sejm Presidium and fractional council confirm that the 2019 Latvian presidential election will be held on May 29.
Early voting for the 2019 Latvian presidential election begins.
MEPs from Latvia react to the provisional results of the 2019 European Parliament elections.
The three candidates for the 2019 Latvian presidential election choose their favorite songs for Latvian Radio 2.
The 2019 Latvian presidential election is held, with Egils Levits becoming the next president of Latvia.

Overview.Summary: The 2019 Latvian presidential election is set to take place on May 29, 2019 (1). The election has been described as a "power game" between political parties (1). The ruling party is expected to win the majority of votes (3), with the final results to be announced on May 25, 2024 (2). In the first round of the Ukrainian presidential election on March 31, 2019, political newcomer Volodymyr Zelensky received 30.24% of the vote (6). The run-off election will take place on April 21, 2019 (4). The election in Indonesia on April 17, 2019 will involve voting for both presidential and parliamentary candidates (9).

Timeline.Text: The first round of Ukraine's presidential election takes place, with political newcomer and TV comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy receiving 30.24% of the vote.
The final election results for the 2019 German European Parliament election are expected to be published.
Comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy surprisingly wins the first round of the Ukrainian presidential election with 30.24% of the vote.
India's general election begins, with over 192 million people eligible to vote.
Indonesia's general election takes place, with around 192 million people eligible to vote.
Ukraine is halfway through its presidential election, with the first round having taken place on March 31 and the run-off scheduled for April 21.
Volodymyr Zelenskiy wins the Ukrainian presidential election by a landslide, taking over 73% of the vote.
Final election results for South Africa's 2019 national and provincial elections are announced, with the ruling party maintaining its national majority.
The 2019-2020 Hong Kong protests are considered a contributing factor in the landslide victory of Tsai Ing-wen during the 2020 Taiwanese presidential election.
Egils Levits is expected to win the vote for Latvia's head of State, with 55 of the members of the Saeima expected to vote for him on May 29.

Overview.Summary: The 2019 Latvian presidential election took place on May 29, 2019 (1). Egils Levits became the new Latvian president after winning a parliamentary vote on July 8, 2019 (3,4,8,9). He assumed office and delivered an address to the nation at the Freedom Monument in Riga on the same day (8). Levits also visited Italy and Vatican on an official visit in April 2019 (7). The election was observed by the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (5).

Timeline.Text: The Latvian center-right government coalition agrees on a date for the upcoming presidential election.
Egils Levits becomes the new Latvian president, taking the oath of office in front of the parliament.
Newly-elected Lithuanian president Gitanas Nauseda visits Latvia and meets with Latvian officials.
Kazakhstan announces snap presidential elections for June 9, 2019.
Latvian President Raimonds Vējonis visits Italy and the Vatican on an official visit.
The OSCE deploys an Election Assessment Mission for the upcoming presidential election in Slovakia.
The presidential and parliamentary elections take place in Indonesia.

Overview.Summary: The 2019 Latvian presidential election was held on May 29 (1). The election was an indirect election, with the Saeima (parliament) voting for the next president (1). However, the date for the election was confirmed on April 9 (1). This election was held alongside the federal election in Australia (2), and was similar to the Australian Senate election in 2024 (3). The election was also compared to the presidential election in Indonesia, where incumbent President Joko Widodo was the front-runner (4). In India, Congress president Rahul Gandhi won the Wayanad Lok Sabha constituency (5). In Lithuania, MP Simonyte from the conservative Homeland Union-Lithuanian Christian Democrats party came first with 31.21% of the vote (6). In Slovakia, the country's first female president was elected (8). In the European Parliament, Ursula von der Leyen was elected as the first woman to hold the EU's top executive job (9). In Australia, Prime Minister Scott Morrison won the election, despite expectations that his Labor opponent, Bill Shorten, would win (10).

Timeline.Text: The parliamentary vote to pick Latvia's next president is scheduled for May 29.
Indonesian President Joko Widodo is the front-runner to win the country's fourth direct presidential election on April 17.
Final results from the Lithuanian presidential election show MP Simonyte in first place and independent economist Nauseda in second place, less than 4,000 votes apart.
Scott Morrison defies expectations and wins the Australian federal election, confounding pollsters.
The writs are issued for the 2019 Australian federal election.
Congress president Rahul Gandhi wins the Wayanad Lok Sabha constituency in Kerala.
Ursula von der Leyen is elected as the next president of the European Commission, becoming the first woman to hold the EU's top executive job.

Overview.Summary: The 2019 Latvian presidential election (10) is set to take place on May 29 and will involve a power game between various parties (1). Egils Levits is the main favorite and is supported by the government coalition parties (4,6). The current president, Raimonds Vejonis, chose not to run for a second term (4). Comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy won a landslide victory in Ukraine's presidential election (2,5,8). The ruling party's national majority was followed by the DA and the EFF (7). Political violence marred the Nigerian elections in 2019 (9). In Latvia, the president is elected by the parliament in a secret ballot (10).

Timeline.Text: Egils Levits is elected as President of Latvia, succeeding Raimonds Vejonis.
Volodymyr Zelenskiy wins a landslide victory in the Ukrainian presidential election.
The comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy is declared the winner of the Ukrainian presidential election.
Egils Levits is favored to win the vote for President of Latvia on May 29th.
The results of the 2019 national and provincial elections in South Africa are announced, with the ruling party maintaining a national majority.
The 2019 Nigerian elections are marred by widespread violence.
The Latvian presidential election is held, with the president being elected by the parliament.

Overview.Summary: The 2019 Latvian presidential election (9) took place on May 29 (1,2,3,4,5,6), with Egils Levits being elected as the new president (8,13). The election was considered a power game between various parties (4) and was held amidst the 2019-2020 Hong Kong protests (14) and the 2022 Brazilian general election (15). The new president of Latvia, along with his wife, also visited Italy and Vatican (12). The election was closely followed by the snap presidential election in Kazakhstan (18) and the Ukrainian presidential election (19,20).

Timeline.Text: Egils Levits is elected as the new President of Latvia.
Snap presidential elections are called in Kazakhstan.
Egils Levits assumes office as the new President of Latvia.
